column4: hi there, so would one still want to use a seperate /boot partition on a todays system? i mean since grub is able to access partitions i could easily just integrate /boot into / and just create and use a / partition and a swap partition. is there a benefit in using a seperate /boot still? thanks.
I don't but a seperate home is often suggested
for new or re installs and yes I know its not needed these days
